alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 10:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Catoosa, north central Walker and northeastern Dade Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1024 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Chattanooga Valley, or 9 miles northeast of Trenton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, Lakeview, Indian Springs, Graysville, Blue Spring, Wildwood, Fairview, Boynton, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker and Rock Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
